title: Tiles
body:
Date

Participants

Summary

Action Items

Conclusions

04-06-2024

Anuj, Rakesh, Harish

Discussed about the issues:

  1. Current Loading Mechanism which is slowing dashboard items loading

  2. Update tile position issue

  3. Tile Records per user

We need to evaluate below things:

  1. Avoid making user specific records for a tile

  2. Check with INT App Tiles what will be the dashboard control setting for App tiles.

  3. Which tiles can be fetched in List Tile api call and which require additional call.

  4. Check which tiles can be cached

  5. We can avoid the update position query when adding a tile. Need to go deep dive into it.

  6. Evaluate the current indexes and required indexes on tiles tables

  7. Evaluate if we can fetch tiles in pagination way

  8. Evaluate if we can limit the number of tiles

title: New European languages
body:
Background:

In order to expand our business in EU regions we have to be prepared with supporting these languages in the Simpplr platform.

  • Finnish

  • Swedish

  • Norwegian

  • Spanish-LATAM

  • Portuguese-EU

We also have to do parity on Zeus for the following two languages

  • Albanian

  • Hindi

Platform : AWS

Timeline : BabbleOn to complete translation by end of 31st Jan 2025

title: Proposal: Restructuring Backyard Sites
body:
The current backyard site structure is not aligned with Simpplr’s team, technology, or vertical structure. I propose restructuring the Backyard sites and categories so that every team or group gets its own workspace where they can organize and share things as they do in confluence or slack.

It would help team members to collaborate on slack, MS teams, and backyard since they will get 1:1 mapping between sites and slack/Microsoft team channels.

The following table shows a very high-level idea for creating sites based on cross-functional and department groups for the company it includes location, cause, department, and team-related groups.

Site names could be promoted as categories for better searching and managing content.
